ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Pioneer 11 Geiger Tube Telescope (GTT) 24-hr count rate data
ResourceHeader.Description: This data set holds 24-hour-averaged count rates and related parameters for each of 8 sensors or multi-sensor coincidence modes, as obtained from the U.Iowa Geiger Tube Telescope (GTT) experiment flown on Pioneer 11. Data have been corrected for RTG and temperature effects. Single-sensor count rates are from the A (directional fluxes of 0.04-21 MeV electrons and 0.61-80 MeV protons, plus omnidirectional fluxes of .GT.21 MeV electrons and .GT.80 MeV protons), B (directional fluxes of 0.56-21 MeV electrons and 9-80 MeV protons, plus omnidirectional fluxes of .GT.21 MeV electrons and .GT.80 MeV protons), C (omnidirectional fluxes of .GT.21 MeV electrons and .GT.80 MeV protons), D (omnidirectional fluxes of .GT.31 MeV electrons and .GT.80 MeV protons), and G (directional fluxes of 0.61-3.41 MeV protons) Geiger tubes. Coincidence mode rates are given for Geiger tube combinations (A,B), (A,B,C) and (D,E,F). The G and (A,B,C) rates are each given multiple times in the 12 rates of each 24-hr record. Additional parameters associated with each count rate include numbers of counts contributing to each count rate, the statistical uncertainty in each rate, and others used in U. Iowa's processing and carried along for posterity. These are described in the document identified in the first "Information URL." The data were provided to NSSDC on a VMS-binary-formatted CD-ROM and were converted to ASCII by GSFC/SPDF in 2010. The data are ftp-accessible in a single 9-MB file and are also accessible with graphical display from an FTPBrowser interface.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Drs. James A. Van Allen, the original PI, and Bruce Randall

InformationURL.Name: Readme at SPDF
InformationURL.Description: Readme with format statement for this ASCII version

AccessURL.Name: FTPS from SPDF (not with most browsers)
HTTPS from SPDF
AccessURL.Description: In CDF via HTTP from SPDF

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: Drs. James A. Van Allen, the original PI, and Bruce Randall at U.Iowa, plus GSFC's Space Physics Data Facility

TimeSpan.Note: Coverage is low after the mid-1990's.

Parameter.Name: Sensor A count rate
Parameter.Description: Count rate due to directional fluxes of 0.04-21 MeV electrons and 0.61-80 MeV protons, plus omnidirectional fluxes of .GT.21 MeV electrons and .GT.80 MeV protons

Parameter.Name: Sensor B count rate
Parameter.Description: Count rate due to directional fluxes of 0.56-21 MeV electrons and 9-80 MeV protons, plus omnidirectional fluxes of .GT.21 MeV electrons and .GT.80 MeV protons

Parameter.Name: Sensor C count rate
Parameter.Description: Count rate due to omnidirectional fluxes of .GT.21 MeV electrons and .GT.80 MeV protons

Parameter.Name: Sensor D count rate
Parameter.Description: Count rate due to omnidirectional fluxes of .GT.31 MeV electrons and .GT.80 MeV protons

Parameter.Name: Sensor G count rate
Parameter.Description: Count rate due to directional fluxes of 0.61-3.41 Mev protons. See also columns 36 and 43.

Parameter.Name: Coincidence mode (A,B) count rate
Parameter.Description: (A,B) coincidence mode count rate due to directional fluxes of .GT.21 MeV electrons and .GT.130 MeV protons.

Parameter.Name: Coincidence mode (A,B,C) count rate
Parameter.Description: (A,B,C) coincidence mode count rate due to directional fluxes of .GT.21 MeV electrons and .GT.130 MeV protons. See also columns 41 and 44.

Parameter.Name: Coincidence mode (D,E,F) count rate
Parameter.Description: (D,E,F) coincidence mode count rate due to omnidirectional fluxes of .GT.31 MeV electrons and .GT.150 MeV protons. E and F are Geiger tubes whose individual count rates are not taken.

Parameter.Name: Standard deviations in all count rates
Parameter.Description: Standard deviations [count rate/SQRT(#points)] in each of the 12 count rates of columns 33-44.

Structure.Description: Standard deviation in the count rates in Columns 33 to 44, respectively

Parameter.Name: Numbers of raw counts in all count rates
Parameter.Description: Number of raw counts in each of the 12 count rates in columns 33-44

Structure.Description: numbers of counts in the count rates in Columns 33 to 44, respectively

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft position information

Structure.Description: Positional parameters for spacecraft and earth
